page.title: 11EDUCATION
page.content: Our school was started in l722 when Thomas Richardson left his land and orchards to be sold to found a school in Ulceby. No one knows where the first school was but in l84O a Church school was built in Church Lane and this was open until a few years ago. When the new school was built by Humberside County Council the school changed from "Aided" to "Controlled" and the Thomas Richardson Trust was no longer needed to repair the school building. The Trustees now meet every year and decide on a budget for the school. This year we are having a hundred new hymn books. The Trustees also give every child a Bible when they leave the school to go to Baysgarth. The school Trustees own land on Carr Road which is rented out. All the money was in Rolls Royce but was taken out and put in Unit Trust.
